original_title: Sri Lanka tea exports up 4.2-pct in May 2023
original_body_lines: ECONOMYNEXT – Sri Lanka’s tea exports were up by 4.21 percent from a year ago to 20.55 million kilograms in May 2023 data showed, as the production increased during the second quarter of the year after a ban on chemical fertilizer was lifted.
Export earnings were 116.3 million dollars in May 2023 up from 93.6 million US dollars a year earlier.

Turkey, being the largest buyer of Ceylon tea, bought 10.8 million kilograms, from January to May, followed by Iraq in second place with 10.4 million kilograms (last year 19.3 million kilos), industry data released by Ceylon Tea Brokers show.
Russia came in third place with 10.2 million kilos (8.4 million kilos in 2022), and UAE was fourth with 6.1 million kilos.
In 2023 so far, the country has exported around 91 million kilos.
Sri Lanka produced around 251 million kilos of tea in 2022 due to the lagged effect of a fertilizer ban pushed for by the Government Medical Officers Association.
The FOB price of a kilo is around 1,755.58 rupees or 5.66 US dollars.
Equivalent USD export earnings for the cumulative period January to May 2023 amounted to approximately 523.08 million US dollars compared with 457.14 million in the same period last year.

Tea prices declined as the rupee started appreciating in the beginning of the second quarter however in the last auction, the prices of tea increased as the rupee weakened against the US dollar in the market. (Colombo/June22/2023)
